articles.title: Letter to Executive Director of Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
articles.content:
Letter to Executive Director of Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Hyong Hun, vice-minister of Public Health of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, sent a letter to Peter Sands, executive director of the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria, on Mar. 10, which said:
					 I have received a letter with a surprise from Mr. Mark Edington, Division Head of the Grant Management of the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria dated 22 February 2018 informing that the Global Fund is closing its grants in the DPRK by 30 June 2018.
					
					 Although the Global Fund claims that the sudden closure of tuberculosis and malaria grants is due to the "unique operating environment" in the DPRK, it can't be seen other than the outcome of the pressure of some hostile forces.  
					
					 This can be proved by the fact that the current closure of tuberculosis and malaria grants was decided without any prior discussion with UNICEF and WHO, both the Principal Recipient and the Sub-Recipient of TB & Malaria programs and moreover, it is timed with announcement of the "maximum pressure" imposed on the DPRK by the U.S. 
					
					 We appreciate the assistance provided by the Global Fund for its substantial contribution to our efforts for eradicating TB and Malaria in the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK Government, in concerted efforts with UNICEF and WHO, has been making progress in its endeavors to eradicate TB and Malaria. However, the Global Fund has notified the closing of the grants unilaterally, without any consideration of aftereffects of the closure which constitutes nothing but an extremely abnormal and inhumane measure.
					
					 In this connection, even the UN agencies, which are implementing TB and Malaria programs in the DPRK, have expressed their concern about possible increase of thousands of MDR TB patients every year among patients who have been treated by GF-provided TB medicines, which would eventually lead to a quick spread among children and other people. Hence they are of the view that the grants should never be closed on any account.
					
					 Therefore, I strongly urge that the Global Fund should consider carefully about the humanitarian impact that could be incurred from the closure of grants, assume due responsibility for it and take measures to put the issue on the right track in conformity with the humanitarian mission before it is too late.

articles.title: Achievements Made in Scientific Fishing
articles.content:
Achievements Made in Scientific Fishing
Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- In recent years, the Kim Chaek Taegyong General Fishery Enterprise in the DPRK has made good hauls by applying scientific fishing methods.
					 The enterprise made a big stride in putting fishing on an IT basis by developing the system for scientific fishing supervision and weather forecast in cooperation with a scientific research institute.
					
					 The system displays the positions and directions of fishing boats on computer screen, so as to ensure the promptness, mobility and correctness in fishing supervision.
					
					 And the enterprise developed a program for analyzing fishing ground conditions like seawater temperature and sea currents to select most ideal fishing ground through comprehensive analysis of detailed data on sea areas.

articles.title: Palhaesamchae Ceramic
articles.content:
Palhaesamchae Ceramic
Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- Palhaesamchae ceramic, a special product of Palhae (698-926), is one of fine national heritages of the Korean people.
					 The ceramic was carefully painted with three colors of glazes before being baked. It is simple in decoration, natural and refined in shape, bright and soft in color, very light in weight and not easy to break.
					
					 And decorative patterns stained on glazed ceramic add beauty to it.
					
					 It is regarded as one of achievements made by Palhae craftsmen in ceramic art that they had well used various color glazes in good harmony with patterns.
					
					 It gives a glimpse of glaze-making technique and ceramics of Palhae that reached a high stage of their development.
					
					 At that time, Palhaesamchae ceramic wares were exported to other countries to win high praises for "being as light as a feather".

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Foiling "Human Rights" Racket of Imperialists
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Foiling "Human Rights" Racket of Imperialists
Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- The imperialists' "human rights" racket should no longer be overlooked in order to build an independent new world in which the sovereignty and equality are ensured for all the countries and nations free from domination, subjugation, aggression and interference, says an article of Rodong Sinmun Tuesday.
					 The imperialists are the kingpin of human rights abuses and human rights criminals who have to face stern punishment by the international community, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The politicization of human rights and application of double standards have to be rejected at international organizations including the UN Human Rights Council. No specified nation can be a judge. But the imperialists, claiming as if they are "human rights judges", are politicizing human rights and attacking and pressurizing progressive countries after singling them out. This strains confrontation and has an adverse impact on the worldwide efforts for protecting human rights.
					
					 Human rights can never come true as long as the imperialists remain on the earth. In order to ensure genuine human rights, one has to build one's own strength. Without strength one cannot fight against those standing against human rights and safeguard genuine human rights, falling victim to the strong.
					
					 The imperialists are resorting to all sorts of sleights of hands under the signboard of "guarantee of human rights", but with nothing can they cover up the deceptive and aggressive nature of their racket for "human rights".

articles.title: Abe's Reckless Bid to Revise Constitution under Fire
articles.content:
Abe's Reckless Bid to Revise Constitution under Fire
Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- Days ago, Japanese Prime Minister Abe reeled off unreasonable remarks at the Budget Committee of the House of Representatives that the "Self-Defense Forces" conform with the Constitution, stressing the need to put an end to the "theory of unconstitutional SDF". He openly forced ruling and opposition parties to hasten the revision of the Constitution stipulating the existence of SDF while keeping the paragraph 2 of Article 9.
					 This clearly shows how keen the Japanese reactionaries are for their ambition for overseas expansion, Minju Joson Tuesday says in a commentary.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The "bill for the revision of the Constitution" was worked out by the persistent assertion that the "Pacifist Constitution" stipulating eternal renouncement of war and use of armed forces should be revised, under the pretext of "security of Japan". Now it is becoming the general target of the Abe regime.
					
					 One of the key points sought by the Abe regime is to stipulate the existence of SDF as regular armed forces.
					
					 The Japan SDF has surpassed the level of "exclusive defense" and radically changed in quality and quantity as full-fledged offensive armed forces for overseas aggression through the persistent moves of decades to turn Japan into a military giant.
					
					 The main target of Japan for overseas aggression is to revise the Constitution for making Japan "a country capable of fighting a war". This is the calculation of the Japanese reactionaries. 
					
					 That is why they make desperate efforts to revise the Constitution stipulating the existence of SDF in defiance of the unanimous opposition and rejection at home and abroad.
					
					 Japan should clearly understand that the chariot of militarism will finally lead to self-destruction.
					
					 Such foolish moves of the Japanese reactionaries, oblivious of the lesson of disgraceful history, will surely end in the ruin of Japan.

articles.title: Federation of National Writers Formed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Federation of National Writers Formed in S. Korea
Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- A federation of national writers was formed in south Korea on March 10, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Jaju Sibo.
					 Kim Hae Hwa, a worker poet, was elected permanent representative at the inaugural meeting held at the Seoul City Office.
					
					 Its inaugural declaration said that the federation would reject the unjust interference and domination of foreign forces and contribute to building a world in which human beings live as befitting masters.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Austria
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Austria
Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- An Austrian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was inaugurated in Vienna on February 23.
					 Thomas Losh, general secretary of the Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to organize political and cultural events in praise of the exploits of the peerlessly great persons on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Austria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Austria
Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- The Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK posted on its internet homepage respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and Our People" on February 27 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The work, published on April 20, Juche 101 (2012), deals with the revolutionary exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in their lifetime.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks for resolutely defending and glorifying the idea and exploits of the great leaders.

articles.title: Korean Film Shows Held Abroad
articles.content:
Korean Film Shows Held Abroad
Pyongyang, March 13 (KCNA) -- Korean film shows were held in Mongolia, Singapore, Nigeria, Angola and Algeria to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Personages of various circles and masses in those countries watched Korean film "Eternal Treasures in Praise of Sun", "Monument to Party Founding" and "My Country Has Emerged Victorious by Dint of Single-minded Unity".
					
					 The director of the Ulan Bator Carpet Company said the DPRK is working miracles in all fields under the wise guidance of H.E. Kim Jong Un creditably carrying forward the idea and cause of H.E. Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The director of the World Travel Agency of Singapore praised the great H.E. Kim Jong Il as the prominent leader who defended the sovereignty of the country with his unique Songun politics.
					
					 Speakers at the film shows in Nigeria lauded Kim Jong Il for consolidating the DPRK as an invincible socialist fortress and training the Korean people to be strong in independence.
					
					 The director of the Construction Company No. 1 of Angola said Kim Jong Il is the iron-willed brilliant commander as he reliably defended peace and security on the Korean peninsula by increasing the country's defence capabilities in every way, adding: The might of the DPRK lies in the single-hearted unity of the leader, the party and the masses and no force on earth can match it.

articles.title: Kim Hyong Hun envia carta al director ejecutivo del fondo mundial
articles.content:
Kim Hyong Hun envia carta al director ejecutivo del fondo mundial
Pyongyang, 13 de marzo (ACNC) -- El viceministro de Salud Publica de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Hyong Hun, envio el dia 10 una carta al director ejecutivo del Fondo Global para Combatir el SIDA, Tuberculosis y Malaria, Peter Sands. 
					La misiva senala como sigue:
					
					He recibido con sorpresa la carta fechada 22 de febrero de 2018 del jefe de la Division de Administracion de Subvencion del Fondo Global para Combatir el SIDA, Tuberculosis y Malaria, Mark Edington, segun la cual esta entidad cerrara hasta el 30 de junio de 2018 la subvencion en la RPDC. 
					
					Aunque el Fondo Global insiste en que su medida de suspension repentina de subvencion se debe al "ambiente operacional especial" en la RPDC, esa no es mas que un producto de la presion de algunas fuerzas deseosas de politizar la cooperacion humanitaria. 
					
					Lo comprueba el hecho de que la presente medida fue tomada sin el debate previo con el Fondo de las Naciones Unidas para la Infancia (UNICEF) y la Organizacion Mundial de la Salud (OMS), encargados directamente de la cooperacion contra tuberculosis y malaria, y coincide con el anuncio de la "maxima presion" impuesta por EE.UU. contra la RPDC. 
					
					Apreciamos la asistencia del Fondo, proporcionada hasta la fecha, por su contribucion sustancial al combate contra la tuberculosis y malaria en nuestro pais. 
					
					En la actualidad, el gobierno de la RPDC alcanza un avance en sus esfuerzos conjuntos con la UNICEF y la OMS por erradicar la tuberculosis y malaria. Pues, resulta una medida anormal e inhumanitaria el aviso del Fondo Global sobre la suspension unilateral de la cooperacion sin tener en consideracion sus consecuencias. 
					
					En este contexto, hasta las organizaciones de la ONU, que implementan los programas contra la tuberculosis y malaria en la RPDC, expresan preocupacion por el posible incremento de miles de pacientes de MDR entre los que recibian el tratamiento con las medicinas de tuberculosis proporcionadas por el Fondo Global y por la consiguiente transmision rapida de esa enfermedad entre los ninos y otros segmentos de la poblacion. Por eso, insisten en que la cooperacion no debe ser suspendida en ningun caso. 
					
					Exijo fuertemente que el Fondo Global tome en consideracion las consecuencias humanitarias que emanen del paro de su cooperacion, asuma la responsabilidad merecida y adopte, antes de que se haga tarde, las medidas para resolver el problema conforme a su mision humanitaria.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena el intento de Abe de modificar la Constitucion
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena el intento de Abe de modificar la Constitucion
Pyongyang, 13 de marzo (ACNC) -- En la reciente comision presupuestaria de la camara de representantes el premier japones Abe hizo pronunciaciones injustas de que las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" son convenientes a la Constitucion e insistio en la necesidad de "poner punto final a la teoria de ilegalidad de estas fuerzas armadas".
					Y obligo abiertamente al partido gobernante y los opositores a acelerar la enmienda de la ley constitucional que estipula la existencia de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa", manteniendo la clausula 2 del articulo 9 de la Constitucion.
					
					Esto muestra claramente que se llego al climax la ambicion de expansion al ultramar de los reaccionarios japoneses.
					
					Asi revela el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual divulgado el dia 13 y continua:
					
					Por la insistencia obstinada en "modificar" bajo el pretexto de la "seguridad de Japon" la "Constitucion Pacifica" que estipula la renuncia perenne de la guerra y el uso de las fuerzas armadas, ya se elaboro el "proyecto de enmienda de constitucion" que se convirtio ahora en la meta final del Poder de Abe.
					
					Una de los objetos que persigue el Poder de Abe en este asunto es la anotacion de la existencia de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" como las fuerzas armadas regulares.
					
					Debido a las maniobras del pais isleno por su conversion en la potencia militar, desarrolladas durante decenios, las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" de Japon superaron el nivel de la "defensa exclusiva" y lograron el considerable cambio cualitativo y cuantitativo como las perfectas fuerzas armadas de ataque para la agresion al ultramar.
					
					Por tanto, la meta principal a ser alcanzado por Japon para la agresion al ultramar es modificar la Constitucion para convertir el archipielago en un "pais capaz de realizar la guerra", lo que es el calculo de los reaccionarios japoneses.
					
					Por eso, estos hacen los esfuerzos tan desesperados por la enmienda de la actual ley constitucional, a pesar del rechazo unanime en el interior y el exterior del pais.
					
					Japon debe tener presente de que el destino del coche militarista sera la autodestruccion.
					
					La locura estupida de los reaccionarios japoneses que dejan en el olvido la leccion de su historia ignominiosa traera sin falta el arruinamiento de su pais.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun aboga por frustrar la campana de "DDHH" de los imperialistas
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun aboga por frustrar la campana de "DDHH" de los imperialistas
Pyongyang, 13 de marzo (ACNC) -- Para construir un mundo libre de dominacion y subyugacion, agresion e intervencion y el nuevo e independiente donde esten garantizadas la soberania e igualdad de todos los paises y naciones, no se debe tolerar ya la campana de "DDHH" de los imperialistas. 
					Adelanta asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual de hoy y prosigue:
					
					Los imperialistas son peores violadores y criminales de DDHH que deben ser castigados duro por la sociedad internacional.
					
					Las organizaciones internacionales como el Consejo de DDHH de la ONU deben rechazar el intento de politizar este tema y aplicar la pauta de doble rasero. 
					
					Portandose como "jueces de DDHH", los imperialistas politizan el problema de DDHH y presionan y critican de modo selectivo a los paises progresistas. Esta conducta agudiza mas la confrontacion y ejerce influencias negativas a los esfuerzos mundiales por proteger los DDHH. 
					
					Los DDHH nunca seran asegurados por si solos mientras existan los imperialistas en el globo terraqueo. Para defender los verdaderos DDHH, es preciso tener gran poder nacional. En el caso contrario, sera ultrajado por los fuertes y no podra luchar contra los que rehusan los genuinos DDHH ni defenderlos. 
					
					Aunque los imperialistas recurren a todas las artimanas bajo el vistoso cartel de "defensa de DDHH", no podran encubrir el caracter enganoso y agresivo de su ofensiva en esta esfera.
